ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Aastha Foundation Aurangabad is a NGO working to provide a much needed attention, and care, love, dignity and respect to the Senior Citizens and make the golden years of their life more comfortable. â€˜Aasthaâ€™ believes that â€˜Ageing with Dignityâ€™ is possible. Aastha Foundation, Aurangabad is registered under Bombay public Trust Act and Societies Act and is established in 2008 by a group of young, dynamic, socially aware people with a dream of making positive changes in various areas of our Society. Aastha Foundation, Aurangabad proposes to establish `Basant Prabha-Visawaâ€™ a residential housing and assisted living for the Senior Citizens. The NGO organizes various activities for Senior Citizens regarding their health, safety, security & entertainment. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: â€¢ Brief History of the Organisation: The organization emerged in 1985 with the objective of overall development of society and started its activities from own â€˜Warapgaonâ€™ village as chief functionary of the organization belongs to the village. Since his childhood, he had a dream to develop at least his own village as a model, which can be replicated in surrounding villages. The period 1985 to 1995 remained most struggling period for the organization. The constructive community development process ware enhanced after 1995 at the organizational level. In due course of the time the organization contributed significantly towards the socio-economic development of the poor and underprivileged. As a token of its contribution the organization â€˜Yuva Gramâ€™ honored with â€˜National Youth Awardâ€™ in the year of 2001 for its contribution towards youth development in Beed district of Maharashtra. Today, it is a well-recognized organization in the fields of women & child empowerment, youth development, agriculture, sanitation, watershed development, environment management, awareness, training, resource mobilization and education. It posses the team of trained staff, well equipped training center, reference library and healthy relations with Govt. officials, like- minded organizations and target groups. Vision: Yuva Gram strives to reform unique structure of society that will create ample opportunities for development and provide space and raise access to mainstreams without discrimination of cast, creed, language, race and religion. We believe a society where in the poor, the marginalized and the under privileged enjoy equal opportunities to take part in developmental process. Mission: Yuva Gram aims at building capacities of poor and needy people in general and youth, women, dalits, tribes and small and marginal farmers with a view furthering their socio- economic conditions with special reference to health, natural resource management and constitutional rights Aims and objectives: â€¢ To attempt for the overall development of Dalit, tribal, de-notified tribes, farmers, land laborers, marginalized farmers as well as women and children from all the categories. â€¢ To undertake studies and conduct research on different social, economical, cultural, and educational and health issues prevailing in the society. â€¢ To use available information and the innovations and create awareness at society level utilizing various campaign mediums as well as creating occasional and in-occasional material required for such campaigns. â€¢ To conduct and impart trainings to the activists at various levels engaged in social development. â€¢ To achieve the tasks of rural development through the science, technologies and the informal education as well as initiating activities to solve the basic problems like education, health and culture faced by the deprived lives in urban areas. â€¢ To organize, conduct and participate in the discussions, conversations, trainings, peopleâ€™s collective programmes and the meets that could be helpful to achieve / fulfill above aims. â€¢ To receive and even extend all the possible support and help from and to the individuals and organizations to implement and conduct the expected programmes according to the aims and the objectives of the organization.

Women empowerment refers to making women powerful to make them capable of deciding for themselves. Women have suffered a lot through the years at the hands of men. In earlier centuries, they were treated as almost non-existent. As if all the rights belonged to men even something as basic as voting. As the times evolved, women realized their power. There on began the revolution for women empowerment.

Women Empowerment is made up of two words women and empowerment. Empowerment means to give power or authority to someone. So, Women Empowerment means power in the hands of women. It signifies that women should be given equal opportunity in every field, irrespective of any discrimination. In this essay on Women Empowerment, we will discuss the need for women empowerment and the ways through which it can be achieved.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: YUVworkstowards the human rights paradigm forming the underlying philosophy of the organisation; and focuses on three different areas â€“ Poverty, Environment and Governance. â€¢ Poverty is seen as a violation of human rights and is multidimensional caused by a number of interlinked factors and hence must be addressed in a holistic and integrated manner. â€¢ The concept of environment includes both the natural environment and human/social environment. This theme focuses on issues of quality, equity and sustainability in relation to the development and management of natural resources and the quality of human life. â€¢ Work on governance centres around facilitation of the democratisation of power and decentralised access to and management of public resources.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Risingâ€¦â€¦â€¦ In 1974, Yuvak Biradari (Bharat) rose to a mission of social development and youth welfare. Some thought that it was the need of the hour to deal with the problems faced by the world but for us they were not problems but priorities. We joined hands with many, realizing that collective voices, strengths and energies are the only way to make a big difference. There is no single, simple path for reaching the world of our dreams, but instead, multiple pathways that would lead toward it. Hence we decided to concentrate on social, educational and cultural advancement. Speedingâ€¦â€¦â€¦ Simple solutions can speed the process of transforming hopeless scenarios into bright futures for a civilized society. Our educational camps and workshops which have trained 5000 youth till date have developed a generation of responsible citizens. Biradariâ€™s â€˜Jodo Bharatâ€™ and â€˜Save the Earthâ€™ campaigns have traversed 35000 kms in India. Our social projects and relief and rehabilitation work over the last 32 years have kindled hope among many disadvantaged groups. Our â€˜Ek Sur Ek Taalâ€™ value education programme has charged the spirits of two million students across India. The social themes of Biradariâ€™s 2500 cultural presentations have created long lasting impressions. 150 regular and ad-hoc centres of Biradari across the country integrated a large number of members and partners along the journey that catalyzed the work of the founders. Proving ourselves in action made it a delightful journey. Accolades like the â€˜National Youth Awardâ€™ by the Government of India and other recognitions acted as a fillip and intensified our cause. Shapingâ€¦â€¦â€¦ Progress is all about changing thoughts and direction with time. Globalization and an urban-rural divide pose new challenges which lead us to new initiatives like Udaan for economic empowerment. Insaani Biradari has also come into being so that we can create value by participation of diverse groups. Challenges like global warming have beckoned us to design projects like Vasundhara Bachao. Biradari continues to strengthen and shape itself in its fourth decade of action, practice and learning.
